sentence: The best performing sector as of midday Wednesday is the Utilities sector, higher by 2.3%.
Within that group, DTE Energy Co (Symbol: DTE) and Public Service Enterprise Group Inc (Symbol: PEG) are two large stocks leading the way, showing a gain of 4.6% and 3.5%, respectively.
Among utilities ETFs , one ETF following the sector is the Utilities Select Sector SPDR ETF (Symbol: XLU), which is up 2.5% on the day, and up 7.35% year-to-date.
DTE Energy Co, meanwhile, is up 9.44% year-to-date, and Public Service Enterprise Group Inc is up 12.37% year-to-date.
Combined, DTE and PEG make up approximately 6.9% of the underlying holdings of XLU.
The next best performing sector is the Consumer Products sector, losing just 0.2%.
Among large Consumer Products stocks, Procter & Gamble Company (Symbol: PG) and Kimberly-Clark Corp. (Symbol: KMB) are the most notable, showing a gain of 3.6% and 3.1%, respectively.
One ETF closely tracking Consumer Products stocks is the iShares U.S. Consumer Goods ETF ( IYK ), which is up 0.6% in midday trading, and down 7.00% on a year-to-date basis.
Procter & Gamble Company , meanwhile, is up 1.36% year-to-date, and Kimberly-Clark Corp., is down 8.53% year-to-date.
Combined, PG and KMB make up approximately 12.5% of the underlying holdings of IYK.

Comparing these stocks and ETFs on a trailing twelve month basis, below is a relative stock price performance chart, with each of the symbols shown in a different color as labeled in the legend at the bottom:

Here's a snapshot of how the S&P 500 components within the various sectors are faring in afternoon trading on Wednesday.
As you can see, one sector is up on the day, while eight sectors are down.
